intro: Mentzelia monosperma, commonly known as the single-seeded mentzelia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is a member of the Loasaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, branched stems and bright yellow to orange flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting various pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Mentzelia monosperma is also known for its unique seed structure, which contains a single, large seed enclosed in a fleshy, seed capsule.
